text:
Setup

Apache configured as the forward proxy , users connects to Internet Via 
Forward Proxy

Issue 

Apache continues file download even though user terminates the download 
request.

We have an Apache configured as forward proxy and users connect to internet 
via this proxy. If a user while browsing initiates a http file download , the 
download starts as usual.

If for some reason users terminates the download at his end , The download 
stops. However the download connection at proxy server still continues and it 
still maintains the download session until download is finished. This results 
in continues occupation of  Internet bandwidth although the users has 
terminated his download. This be apache is configured on RHEL Lunix 3.0 ES and 
all apache versions (httpd 2.0.48, 2.0.50 and 2.2.0.)
)

Why does proxy still continue this download?
creator: anil@cordys.com

text:
Should have been fixed a long time ago in r125612
(http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&revision=125612).
Anyway it might even make sense in certain situations to turn off this behaviour
and continue to send data in the case that mod_cache is in place as it might be
useful to get the full response cached even if the user in front of the browser
lost patience. But I guess the according switch and "faking" a still working
client should be better handled by mod_cache as by mod_proxy.
